intro: Craniospermum mongolicum, commonly known as the Mongolian skullcap, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Mongolia and northern China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, and it produces small, rounded fruits that contain several seeds. Craniospermum mongolicum is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
